alert.note: Alert for Haywood (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 2:19AM EDT until May 27 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Pigeon River At Canton affecting Haywood County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Elevated stream flows continue along the Pigeon River with a chance that the Pigeon River near Canton will exceed the Action/Advisory Stage of 8.0 feet before 4am. * WHERE...Pigeon River At Canton. * WHEN...Until this morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water may begin to flood parts of Vance Street closest to the river and some parts of Fiberville Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM EDT Friday the stage was 7.6 feet and rising slowly. - Forecast...Expect a small rise to near 8.0 feet before 4am followed by the final recession. There is a small chance the river may rise to a crest of 8.5 feet before cresting early this morning. The chance of new Minor Flooding at Canton is currently near zero. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement should be issued this morning before 800 AM EDT.
